Dear Sally Jo Mouw:
Attached is the Original Licensing Study Report for the above referenced facility. The
study has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing statutes and
administrative rules. Therefore, an original license is issued.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616)204-6992.
Sincerely,
Holly Austin, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
Grant Me Hope is located in Holland Michigan. The agency office is the same
building as another business; however, designated office space that allows for
confidentiality and privacy is provided. The office space includes equipment and
supplies needed to do perform the functions of the agency. A locked file cabinet in
which confidential files will be maintained is in the office space. The Chief
2

Administrator reported agency staff will primarily work remotely and will have
laptops and equipment to complete their jobs.
B. Program Description
Grant Me Hope will provide adoptive family assessments, child adoption
assessments, and adoptive placement services for local and interstate adoptions.
Additionally, they will license foster homes and place youth in foster homes in the
event placement is needed prior to adoption finalization.
Grant Me Hope provides adoptions for youth of all ages and races who have
either been released under Michigan's Safe Delivery of Newborns law or for
whom parental rights have been released. The families served by the agency
must be heterosexual and could either be a single a person or a married couple.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
None
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on substantial compliance with the rules, it is recommended that a six-month
original license be issued.
March 5, 2024
